statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: K.C. Rivers had 21 points and 11 rebounds to help No. 15 Clemson beat Division II Puerto Rico-Mayaguez, 90-73, on Thursday in the San Juan Shootout.
article.headline: After exam break, Clemson breaks free of slow start against Division II team
article.linkText: No. 15 Clemson passes first test in San Juan
article.story: GUAYNABO, Puerto Rico (AP) -- The Clemson Tigers needed a little time to get warmed up after a two-week break for final exams. K.C. Rivers had 21 points and 11 rebounds to help No. 15 Clemson beat Division II Puerto Rico-Mayaguez 90-73 on Thursday in the San Juan Shootout. "We decided to establish ourselves in the second half and try to put the game away," Rivers said. "We had a sense that if we didn't come out with a hard edge, they were going to come out pretty hard." Rivers, who went 9-for-12, scored eight consecutive points in the second half to give the Tigers their biggest lead of the game, 78-51. Terrence Oglesby also had 21 points for Clemson (9-0), and Raymond Sykes and Trevor Booker added 11 points each. Steven Ramirez led Puerto Rico-Mayaguez (1-11) with 21 points and seven assists. The Tigers led 25-23 with less than 7 minutes to play in the first half, but pulled away for a 46-37 halftime advantage. "We started setting goals to stop them four times in a row, five times in a row. That was kind of our battle cry on the bench," coach Oliver Purnell said. "It was kind of natural that we would have trouble finding our sea legs," he said. The Tigers put the game out of reach in the second half with a 13-0 run that included two 3-pointers and a layup from Rivers that put them ahead 78-51 with 9:20 remaining. Bulldogs coach Fernando Toro said his Division II team surprised even him with its ability to stay competitive with a ranked Division I opponent. "I am really surprised that we were able to fight with them," Toro said.
